description: Roof extension to rear (main) roof slope incorporating a Juliet balcony; rear roof extension to rear outrigger roof slope incorporating a Juliet balcony and installation of two roof lights to front roof slope
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: Block Plan, PP-01 Existing Ground Floor Plan, PP-02 Existing First Floor Plan, PP-03 Existing Loft Floor Plan, PP-04 Existing Roof Top Plan, PP-05 Existing Elevations and Section, PP-06 Proposed Ground Floor Plan, PP-07 Proposed First Floor Plan, PP-08-A(R1) Proposed Loft Floor Plan, PP-09-A(R1) Proposed Roof Top Plan, PP-10-A(R1) Proposed Elevations and Section, PP-11-(R1) Existing and Proposed Side Elevations, PP-12-A(R1) Existing and Proposed Site Plans, PP-13 Comparison Sheet.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and shall contain obscure glass and be fixed shut and retained as such for the lifetime of the development

Reason: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The window/s inserted in the side elevation shall be obscure glazed and non-opening (where openable parts less than 1.7m above floor) unless otherwise confirmed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To safeguard neighbouring amenity from light pollution in accordance with policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD.
